Name: batch_size_grokking
Title: Batch Size Grokking: Assessing the impact of the training batchsize on the grokking phenomenon
Experiment: Modify the experiments to dynamically adjust the batch size during training, starting with a small batch size and gradually increasing it. This could potentially lead to faster generalization on the validation set.

Name: optimizer_stability_nosiy_data
Title: Early-Stage Stability Analysis: How Different Optimizers Handle Noisy Data
Experiment: Compare the impact of various optimizers (Adam, SGD with momentum, RMSprop) on model stability when training neural networks with noisy or limited data.

Name: meta_adaptive_regularizer
Title: Exploring Adaptive Regularization Strategies via Meta-Learning and Bayesian Neural Networks
Experiment: Modify an existing architecture to incorporate a learnable regularization scheme that can be adapted using meta-learning or Bayesian neural networks. Analyze the effects of this adaptive regularizer on model performance and generalizability.

Name: multi_metric_hyper_tuning
Title: Hyperparameter Tuning Strategies for Fair, Robust, and Accurate Machine Learning Models
Experiment: Modify the existing code to incorporate a suite of model evaluation metrics (fairness, robustness, accuracy, precision, recall, F1-score) alongside hyperparameter tuning methods, evaluating their effects on model performance across different models and datasets.

Name: SHAPplorer
Title: An Interactive Visualization Tool for Model Interpretability
Experiment: Develop an interactive graph-based visualization tool combining SHAP values and saliency maps. Allow users to dynamically adjust parameters for a more intuitive exploration of complex models.

Name: interpretability_grokking
Title: Model Interpretability and Grokking Phenomenon: A Comprehensive Experimental Study
Experiment: Design a 2x2 or 3x3 experimental study to investigate the effect of model interpretability on generalization performance across multiple datasets with varying levels of complexity.
